content: simple hat band by holly webb dress up a plain hat or upcycle an old one by crocheting a new hat band for it this pattern uses us terms for crochet and is a simple adjustable recipe this pattern is also good for stash busting the bands pictured here used handy hands lizbeth 20 cotton thread red white and blue nazli gelin garden 10 cotton thread black and white and dmc cebelia 10- all leftovers from other projects i used a 1 65mm hook for both bands as it s my favorite steel hook buttons were also from stash ingredients ● crochet thread size 10 or 20 - small fraction of a ball ● steel hook us size 7 1 65mm ● 1 button approximately the width of your band or use a bigger button if you re feeling fancy ● sewing needle with an eye large enough for your crochet thread choice gauge not terribly important you don t want to work too loosely or too tightly you ll want your band to have some drape but not be shapeless or gauzy or too stretchy you re aiming for a ribbon-like texture and consistency for reference with size 10 thread and 1 65mm hook at 8 double_crochet across my band was ¾ inch wide steps 1 measure the circumference of your hat around where you would place the band write this measurement down or keep your hat handy 2 it s very simple to make a wider or narrower band just adjust your stitch count accordingly my black and white band as shown is 8 double_crochet wide approx ¾ inch wide 3 set-up row leaving a six inch tail chain 11 you will use this tail later to sew on your button row 1 in the third chain from hook double_crochet double_crochet across 8 dcs total including the first chains as turning chain row 2 chain 3 counts as double_crochet double_crochet across 8 dcs total repeat row 2 keeping a consistent stitch count until you re almost to the desired length of the band slightly stretch out your band as you work there will be some give and this will help even out your work when you re at the desired circumference wrap your band around your hat to check the ends should just touch don t tie off yet final row is the button loop chain 10 whatever your double_crochet count is plus 2 if your button is much wider than your band you might need more chains slip_stitch to your last stitch in your row to form your loop bind off and darn in the end using the tail from the cast-on weave it through to the place where you d like your button and sew on your button button loop detail image
